name: Destination
shortDesc: The AWS::Logs::Destination resource creates an Amazon CloudWatch Logs (CloudWatch Logs) destination, which enables you to specify a physical resource (such as an Amazon Kinesis stream) that subscribes to CloudWatch Logs log events from another AWS account. For more information, see Cross-Account Log Data Sharing with Subscriptions in the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.

properties.name: DestinationName
properties.desc: The name of the CloudWatch Logs destination.

properties.name: DestinationPolicy
properties.desc: An AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy that specifies who can write to your destination.

properties.name: RoleArn
properties.desc: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that permits CloudWatch Logs to send data to the specified AWS resource (TargetArn).

properties.name: TargetArn
properties.desc: The ARN of the AWS resource that receives log events. Currently, you can specify only an Amazon Kinesis stream.
